source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence a raceme or slender, few-branched panicle with appressed branches; spikelets mostly 7–10 mm long, falling with pedicel or section of branch attached; rare, in marshes of East Gippsland
Inflorescence a panicle with spreading branches; spikelets mostly 4–7 mm long, detaching from panicle immediately below glumes; swamps and lagoons of northern part of State
